rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the number of students of the given student type who are in the demographic class at the educational institution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the percentage of students of the given student type who are in the demographic class at the educational institution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Percentage

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the class of students, e.g. international students, who have the given demography at the given educational institution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Student Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all student organization. Student organizations are the organizations operated by students at a given educational institution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Student Organization

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all student radio stations. These are the radio stations run and organized by students at an educational institution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Student Radio Station

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:education.student_radio_station to its mso:education.educational_institution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: School

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Relationship collecting the data the student and teacher ratio for a given date.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Student/Teacher Ratio

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:education.student_teacher_ratio to the date the ratio is valid.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:education.student_teacher_ratio to the number of students.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Students

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:education.student_teacher_ratio to the number of teachers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Teachers

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An enumeration of the various kinds of students at an educational institution, e.g. international student, transfer student, first-year student, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Student Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard tests, e.g. for admission to educational institutions.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Test

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A value type with properties specifying the performance of students at a given educational institution on standard tests for a given year.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Test Score

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the average score for the given students on the given test at the educational institution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Average Score

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:education.test_score to the mso:education.field_of_study to which the test score applies.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Course

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:education.test_score to the mso:education.grade_level to which the test score applies.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Grade Level

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the high score for the given students on the given test at the educational institution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: High Score

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the low score for the given students on the given test at the educational institution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Low Score

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies whether the test if required, recommended, optional, etc. for the given educational institution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Norm

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The percentile corresponding to the average test score.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Test Score Percentile

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the percentile range corresponding to the average test score.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Percentile Range

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the ranking required on the given test for students at the educational institution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Required Rank

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the score required on the given test for students at the educational institution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Required Score

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:education.test_score to the originating source data.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Source

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the type of student, e.g. international student or first-year student, for which the given test data is valid.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Student Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The standard test corresponding to the average score, e.g. SAT or ACT.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Test

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies what the test score is used for, e.g. placement, counseling, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Test Used for

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The year for which the test score is valid.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Year

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person or organization that specializes in individualized education or test preparation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tutoring Service

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
Academic institutions that offer tertiary level education and grant degrees. This type includes universities, four-year colleges, community colleges, technical colleges, etc.
Things that are colleges and universities:
## Bachelor???s degree granting institutions such as universities and four-year colleges (e.g. Carnegie Mellon University, National College of Ireland, Keio University).
## Associate degree granting institutions such as two-year colleges, technical schools and vocational colleges (e.g. Nassau Community College, Bow Valley, Stockport College, School of Communication Arts).
## Master???s and doctoral degree granting institutions (e.g. Claremont Graduate University, Naval Postgraduate School, All Souls College, Oxford).
## Universities and colleges that are parent institutions as well as its subsidiary or constituent institutions such as individual colleges (e.g. University of Oxford, Balliol College, Oxford, St. John???s College Oxford, Paris-Sorbonne University, Abu Dhabi).
## Institutions that grant college degrees through e-courses, webcasts and distance learning education programs (e.g. Open University of Hong Kong, Westwood College Online, Open University).
## Religious colleges that grant degrees (e.g. Jewish Theological Seminary, Umm al-Qura, Calvary Bible College).
Things that are NOT colleges or universities:
## Schools offering only K-12 education (e.g. Palmetto Middle School, Fairhope High School, Indian High School) Use mso:education.school for these.
## Vocational and technical high schools (e.g. Benson Polytechnic High School, Burgard Vocational High School, Shohoku College) Use mso:education.high_school for these.
## University systems, which are sets of affiliated independent universities and colleges. Use mso:education.university_system for these.
## Dormitories, halls, and residential colleges that merely serve as student housing and do not themselves provide academic programs (e.g. St. Marks College, Dillon Hall, Makiling Residence Hall) Use mso:architecture.building for these.
## Social organizations associated with a college/university (e.g. Phi Tau, Tyron Coterie, Bullingdon Club) Use mso:education.educational_institution_organization or one of its subtypes for these.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: College/University

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The percentage of people who applied in a given year and were actually admitted (i.e., a value between 0 and 100, where 100 means all students who applied were accepted).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Acceptance Rate

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:education.university to its mso:education.departments.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Departments

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: This is for full-time, undergraduate tuition. Some universities offer a tuition rate to students who are citizens or residents of a country or group of countries. If the university does not, leave this blank. For example, many universities offer one tuition for all students from the country the university is in; also, many universities in EU countries have one tuition for any student from an EU country.\n\nThe year value should be the calendar year that begins the academic year (e.g. for academic year 2011-2012, enter "2011").
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Domestic tuition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:education.university to its associated mso:education.fraternity_sorority.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fraternities and sororities

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The percentage of students who are entering their undergraduate studies, are planning to get a bachelor degree, and complete their degree program within a specified amount of time, usually four or five years.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Graduation Rate

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: This is for full-time, undergraduate tuition. Some universities offer a tuition rate to students from countries outside the domestic region (which is defined differently from university to university). If the university does not, leave this blank. For example, many schools offer one rate to students from their country, and another to students from all other countries; also, many universities in EU countries offer one tuition to students from outside the EU.\n\nThe year value should be the calendar year that begins the academic year (e.g. for academic year 2011-2012, enter "2011").
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: International tuition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: This is for full-time, undergraduate tuition. Some universities offer a tuition rate to students who are from some region local (that is, smaller than the country) to the university. If the university does not, leave this blank. For example, many publicly-funded universities in the United States offer a reduced tuition for students living in the same state as the university.\n\nThe year value should be the calendar year that begins the academic year (e.g. for academic year 2011-2012, enter "2011").
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Local tuition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of students on the body who are working towards an advanced academic degree, such as doctor of philosophy
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of doctoral candidates

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of students who are members of this college and have previously completed a degree
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of postgraduates

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The number of students on the body who have yet to gain their first degree.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of undergraduates

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating a university to the department responsible for admitting undergraduate students to the university.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Undergraduate Admissions Office

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A university system is an organization which oversees a group of colleges and universities. Each member university of a university system handles its own admissions, record keeping and accreditation. Constituent colleges and universities also have their own Chief Executive (President, Chancellor, Vice Chancellor, Rector, etc.) and college administration.
Things that are university systems:
## A set of affiliated colleges or universities (e.g. University Aix-Marseille, Rajamangala University of Technology).
## State or city university systems (e.g. City University of New York, University of California).
## Community college systems (e.g. Illinois Community College System, North Harris Montgomery Community College District).
Things that are NOT university systems:
## Individual Institutions (e.g. Bennington College, Gadjah Mada University, University of Western Sydney). Use mso:education.university for these.
## Multi-campus universities (e.g. Tufts University, Australian Catholic University). Use mso:education.university for these.
## Universities (e.g. Yale University, University of Oxford) Use mso:education.university for these.
## School districts (e.g. Baltimore City Public School System). Use mso:education.school_district for these.
## Online universities, which typically have one president and one admissions process (e.g. University of Phoenix). Use mso:education.university for these.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: University System
